Description: Scarab, made of glazed steatite, the back is partly damaged. The steatite is of a light grey colour, quite worn and smoothed at the back, remains of beige glaze preserved on the base. The division between head and prothorax is indicated by a notch at each side. The division between prothorax and elytra is shown in a single line. The suture is not shown. The head is barely preserved but seemed to have been very stylized without details, the clypeus is shown in two outer lines. The side of the scarab shows one circumferential line for the fore- and hind legs, and one askew line for the middle legs. Underneath one line on each lateral side to separate the scarab from the baseplate. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base, inside a thoroughly cutting of an upright wAD.t facing to the right, in front of her a lotus and a flower, underneath a nfr-sign. Both flowers and the nfr-sign are connected by a line to the base of the snake. The longitudinal perforation is fully preserved.
